TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 90

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 90

div1.p: Charles McDormitt having made application to me Jos. Duelle Comissary of Police for the Mine a Burton to settle on a Piece of Land lying on the Mill Creek about six miles from the Mine a Burton where he wishes to make an establishment. Now be it known that I have given Liberty to the said Charles McDormitt to make a settlement on any Piece of Land not claimed by others, and there to reside so long as he shall conduct himself as a good Subject and agreeable to the Regulations of this Province.
A Lá Meine a Breton Le 3 Desambre 1803
